##### Question 1. 

The built in billboard dataset is not tidy. Describe why it is not tidy and then tidy the dataset.

```{r question-1-response}

# First gather up all the week entries into a row for each week for each song (where there is an entry)
billboard2 <- billboard %>% 
  pivot_longer(
    wk1:wk76, 
    names_to = "week", 
    values_to = "rank", 
    values_drop_na = TRUE
  )
billboard2



# Then, convert the week variable to a number and figure out the date corresponding to each week on the chart
billboard3 <- billboard2 %>%
  mutate(
    week = as.integer(gsub("wk", "", week)),
    date = as.Date(date.entered) + 7 * (week - 1),
    date.entered = NULL
  )
billboard3
```

##### Question 3. 

Import the flowers1 dataset. Tidy and pivot the data. Hint: use "read_csv2()" to read in the dataset 

```{r question-3-response}
# Read the dataset using read_csv2()
flowers_data <- read_csv2("flowers1.csv")

# Convert the "Variable" column to character
flowers_data$Variable <- as.character(flowers_data$Variable)

# Tidy and pivot the data using pivot_longer()
tidy_data <- flowers_data %>%
  mutate(Time = as.numeric(Time), replication = as.numeric(replication)) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c(Time, replication, Variable, Value), names_to = "Measurement", values_to = "Value", values_drop_na = TRUE)
```

##### Question 5.

In the following dataset, turn the implicit missing values to explicit 

```{r question-5-response}
output <- tibble(
      treatment   = c("a", "b", "a", "c", "b"),
      gender   = factor(c("M", "F", "F", "M", "M"), levels = c("M", "F", "O")),
      return = c(1.5, 0.75,  0.5,  1.8,  NA)
    )
output


df <- output %>%
  complete(treatment, gender, fill = list(return = NA))
df
```
